eToro API’s documentation¶

eToroWrapperServer¶

class eToroWrapperServer.eToroWrapperServer[source]¶
change_mode(mode)[source]¶

This method enables changing between “virtual” and “real” mode

Parameters

mode (string) – Mode you want to change. It can be “virtual” or “real”

Returns

Returns a json response which the status of the request and the information requested if succeed

Return type

Response

close_position(active, id)[source]¶

This method enables closing an existing position.

Parameters

  • active (string) – Name used for an active in the eToro Web IDE.

  • id (int) – Current id for the target position.

Returns

Returns a json response which the status of the request and the information requested if succeed

Return type

Response

get_active_info(action, active)[source]¶

This method provides detailed info about and active for a buying or selling action

Parameters

  • action (string) – The action type. It can be “buy” or “sell”

  • active (string) – Name used for an active in the eToro Web IDE.

Returns

Returns a json response which the status of the request and the information requested if succeed

Return type

Response

get_portfolio(active)[source]¶

This method provides general or specific info from user’s porfolio such as actives managed or positions opened of each active. This method can be called by requesting to /get_portfolio/<string:active>

Parameters

active (string) – Its value should be the name of a specific active (btc, ethereum…) or the word general in order to get the general user portfolio.

Returns

Returns a json response which the status of the request and the information requested if succeed

Return type

Response

get_wallet_info()[source]¶

This method provides the user wallet info. It can be called by requesting /get_wallet_info

Returns

Returns a json response which the status of the request and the information requested if succeed

Return type

Response

init_driver()[source]¶

This methods initialize webdriver and logs in eToro GUI. Can be called requesting to / endpoint

Returns

Returns a json response which the status of the request

Return type

Response

open_position(action, active, leverage, amount)[source]¶

This method enables opening a new position. It can manage some parameters such as action type, active, leverage and amount

Parameters

  • action (string) – The action type. It can be “buy” or “sell”

  • active (string) – Name used for an active in the eToro Web IDE.

  • leverage (string) – Leverage multiplier. It should be an available value in eToro Web IDE.

  • amount (string) – Amount of active.

Returns

Returns a json response which the status of the request and the information requested if succeed

Return type

Response

setRoutes()[source]¶

This method maps API endpoints with each functional method

change_mode(mode)[source]¶

  • id (int) – Current id for the target position.

get_active_info(action, active)[source]¶

Gather some key data about an active

Parameters

  • action (string) – The action type. It can be “buy” or “sell”

  • active (string) – Its value should be the name of a specific active (btc, ethereum…) or the word general in order to get the general user portfolio. If active is “general” general portfolio view is returned.

Returns

Raw dict which contains some specific information about an active

Return type

dict

get_portfolio(active)[source]¶

Gather user’s portfolio info

Parameters

active (string) – Its value should be the name of a specific active (btc, ethereum…) or the word general in order to get the general user portfolio. If active is “general” general portfolio view is returned.

Returns

Raw list which contains the requested information

Return type

string

get_wallet_info()[source]¶

Gather user’s wallet info

Returns

Raw element which contains the requested information

Return type

string

open_position(action, active, leverage, amount)[source]¶

This method enables opening a new position

Parameters

  • action (string) – The action type. It can be “buy” or “sell”

  • active (string) – Name used for an active in the eToro Web IDE.

  • leverage (string) – Levarage rate

  • amount (string) – Active amount

set_position_window(action, leverage, amount)[source]¶

Auxiliary method which refill form fields automatically

Parameters

  • action (string) – The action type. It can be “buy” or “sell”

  • leverage (string) – Levarage rate

  • amount (string) – Active amount

Raises

LeverageNotAvailable – This exception is raised when an unavailable leverage rate is provided

setup()[source]¶

Logs in the eToro Web IDE

Parser¶

caption

Auxiliary useful functions to clean up raw data from eToro Web IDE
